api/GameFrameX.Core.Abstractions.ActorTy.title: Enum ActorType | GameFrameX.Server
api/GameFrameX.Core.Abstractions.ActorTy.keywords: Enum ActorType Namespace GameFrameX.Core.Abstractions Assembly GameFrameX.Core.Abstractions.dll 每个服存在多个实例的（如玩家和公会）需要小于Separator 最大id应当小于999 Id一旦定义了不应该修改 public enum ActorType Extension Methods ObjectExtension.IsNotNull(object) ObjectExtension.IsNull(object) Fields Account = 130 账号 管理玩家账号信息，如注册、密码找回等。 Achievement = 23 成就 Advertisement = 25 广告 管理游戏内广告展示和广告投放和验证 Analytics = 26 分析 收集和分析玩家行为数据，用于优化游戏。 Archive = 32 存档 存储旧版本数据或历史数据，用于数据恢复。 Arena = 37 竞技场 管理玩家在竞技场的对战和排名。 Attribute = 43 属性 管理角色或对象的属性，如力量、智力等。 AuctionHouse = 36 拍卖行 管理拍卖行的物品列表和交易。 Authentication = 18 认证 负责用户身份验证和授权。 Backup = 14 备份 负责数据的定期备份和灾难恢复。 Cache = 9 缓存 提供数据缓存服务，提高访问速度和减轻数据库压力。 Chat = 3 聊天 管理玩家间的聊天和社交功能。 Combat = 40 战斗 专门处理游戏中的战斗逻辑和同步。 Configuration = 29 配置 管理游戏配置和设置，允许动态调整。 DataBase = 8 数据库 存储和管理游戏数据，如玩家信息、物品数据等。 DataMining = 49 数据挖掘 进行数据挖掘以发现玩家行为模式和趋势。 Email = 24 邮件 处理游戏内邮件系统，发送通知和奖励。 Environment = 35 环境 管理游戏世界的环境因素，如天气、时间等。 Equipment = 42 装备 管理玩家装备和装备属性。 Feedback = 46 用户反馈 收集和处理用户反馈和报告。 Gate = 2 网关 作为客户端和游戏服务器之间的中介，处理网络通信。 Global = 7 全局 Guild = 38 公会 管理公会的创建、管理和活动。 Log = 28 日志 收集和存储游戏日志，用于问题诊断和数据分析。 Logic = 6 逻辑 负责处理游戏规则、玩家行为、AI等逻辑。 Marketplace = 33 市场 管理游戏内市场和虚拟商品的销售。 Match = 10 匹配 负责玩家匹配，组队和创建比赛。 Max = 999 最大值 Monitoring = 16 监控 监控游戏服务器的状态和性能。 None = 0 空将会被判断为无效值 NpcBehavior = 44 NPC行为 控制NPC的行为和交互。 Payment = 13 支付 处理游戏内购买和交易。 Player = 1 角色 管理玩家角色 PlayerBehaviorPrediction = 52 玩家行为预测 预测玩家行为以提供个性化的游戏体验。 PlayerBehaviorRecognition = 53 玩家行为识别 识别和奖励积极的玩家行为或处理不当行为。 PlayerFeedbackResponse = 47 玩家反馈响应 提供玩家反馈响应和处理 Ranking = 19 排行榜 管理玩家的排名和排行榜数据。 Recommendation = 27 推荐 根据玩家行为推荐游戏内容或商品。 Resource = 15 资源 管理和分发游戏资源，如地图、纹理、音效等。 Room = 39 房间 管理房间的创建、管理和活动。 Scene = 11 场景 负责具体的游戏场景，处理场景内的玩家和对象。 Script = 45 脚本 执行和管理游戏脚本和自定义逻辑。 Security = 30 安全 检测和防御游戏中的安全漏洞 负责游戏安全，如反作弊和防止非法行为。 Separator = 128 分割线(勿调整,勿用于业务逻辑) Server = 129 固定ID类型Actor Skill = 41 技能 管理玩家技能和技能树。 Social = 22 社交 管理玩家的社交网络和好友系统。 Support = 48 客户支持 提供客户支持和帮助请求的处理。 Task = 5 任务 管理游戏内任务和任务进度。 Team = 20 团队 管理玩家的队伍信息。 Test = 31 测试 用于游戏测试和调试，可能包含新功能或修复。 Trade = 12 交易 处理游戏内交易。 Tutorial = 51 游戏教程 提供新玩家教程和游戏指导。 Update = 17 更新 负责游戏内容的更新和补丁分发。 UserGeneratedContent = 34 用户生成内容 管理用户生成的内容，如自定义地图、关卡等。 VirtualCurrency = 50 虚拟货币 管理游戏中的虚拟货币系统. Voice = 21 语音 处理游戏内语音聊天。 World = 4 世界 管理游戏世界的状态，包括地图信息、NPC、环境等。

api/GameFrameX.Utility.Verifier.Crc64.ht.title: Class Verifier.Crc64 | GameFrameX.Server
api/GameFrameX.Utility.Verifier.Crc64.ht.keywords: Class Verifier.Crc64 Namespace GameFrameX.Utility Assembly GameFrameX.Utility.dll Provides an implementation of the CRC-64 algorithm as described in ECMA-182, Annex B. public sealed class Verifier.Crc64 : Verifier.NonCryptographicHashAlgorithm Inheritance object Verifier.NonCryptographicHashAlgorithm Verifier.Crc64 Inherited Members Verifier.NonCryptographicHashAlgorithm.HashLengthInBytes Verifier.NonCryptographicHashAlgorithm.Append(byte[]) Verifier.NonCryptographicHashAlgorithm.Append(Stream) Verifier.NonCryptographicHashAlgorithm.GetCurrentHash() Verifier.NonCryptographicHashAlgorithm.TryGetCurrentHash(Span<byte>, out int) Verifier.NonCryptographicHashAlgorithm.GetCurrentHash(Span<byte>) Verifier.NonCryptographicHashAlgorithm.GetHashAndReset() Verifier.NonCryptographicHashAlgorithm.TryGetHashAndReset(Span<byte>, out int) Verifier.NonCryptographicHashAlgorithm.GetHashAndReset(Span<byte>) object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Extension Methods ObjectExtension.CheckNotNull<T>(T, string) ObjectExtension.CheckNotNull<T>(T, string, string) ObjectExtension.IsNotNull(object) ObjectExtension.IsNull(object) Remarks For methods that return byte arrays or that write into spans of bytes, this implementation emits the answer in the Big Endian byte order so that the CRC residue relationship (CRC(message concat CRC(message))) is a fixed value) holds. For CRC-64 this stable output is the byte sequence { 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00 }. There are multiple, incompatible, definitions of a 64-bit cyclic redundancy check (CRC) algorithm. When interoperating with another system, ensure that you are using the same definition. The definition used by this implementation is not compatible with the cyclic redundancy check described in ISO 3309. Constructors Crc64() Initializes a new instance of the Verifier.Crc64 class. public Crc64() Methods Append(ReadOnlySpan<byte>) Appends the contents of source to the data already processed for the current hash computation. public override void Append(ReadOnlySpan<byte> source) Parameters source ReadOnlySpan<byte> The data to process. GetCurrentHashAsUInt64() Gets the current computed hash value without modifying accumulated state. public ulong GetCurrentHashAsUInt64() Returns ulong The hash value for the data already provided. GetCurrentHashCore(Span<byte>) Writes the computed hash value to destination without modifying accumulated state. protected override void GetCurrentHashCore(Span<byte> destination) Parameters destination Span<byte> The buffer that receives the computed hash value. GetHashAndResetCore(Span<byte>) Writes the computed hash value to destination then clears the accumulated state. protected override void GetHashAndResetCore(Span<byte> destination) Parameters destination Span<byte> Hash(byte[]) Computes the CRC-64 hash of the provided data. public static byte[] Hash(byte[] source) Parameters source byte[] The data to hash. Returns byte[] The CRC-64 hash of the provided data. Exceptions ArgumentNullException source is null. Hash(ReadOnlySpan<byte>) Computes the CRC-64 hash of the provided data. public static byte[] Hash(ReadOnlySpan<byte> source) Parameters source ReadOnlySpan<byte> The data to hash. Returns byte[] The CRC-64 hash of the provided data. Hash(ReadOnlySpan<byte>, Span<byte>) Computes the CRC-64 hash of the provided data into the provided destination. public static int Hash(ReadOnlySpan<byte> source, Span<byte> destination) Parameters source ReadOnlySpan<byte> The data to hash. destination Span<byte> The buffer that receives the computed hash value. Returns int The number of bytes written to destination. HashToUInt64(ReadOnlySpan<byte>) Computes the CRC-64 hash of the provided data. public static ulong HashToUInt64(ReadOnlySpan<byte> source) Parameters source ReadOnlySpan<byte> The data to hash. Returns ulong The computed CRC-64 hash. Reset() Resets the hash computation to the initial state. public override void Reset() TryHash(ReadOnlySpan<byte>, Span<byte>, out int) Attempts to compute the CRC-64 hash of the provided data into the provided destination. public static bool TryHash(ReadOnlySpan<byte> source, Span<byte> destination, out int bytesWritten) Parameters source ReadOnlySpan<byte> The data to hash. destination Span<byte> The buffer that receives the computed hash value. bytesWritten int On success, receives the number of bytes written to destination. Returns bool true if destination is long enough to receive the computed hash value (8 bytes); otherwise, false.

api/GameFrameX.Utility.Verifier.NonCrypt.keywords: Class Verifier.NonCryptographicHashAlgorithm Namespace GameFrameX.Utility Assembly GameFrameX.Utility.dll Represents a non-cryptographic hash algorithm. public abstract class Verifier.NonCryptographicHashAlgorithm Inheritance object Verifier.NonCryptographicHashAlgorithm Derived Verifier.Crc64 Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Extension Methods ObjectExtension.CheckNotNull<T>(T, string) ObjectExtension.CheckNotNull<T>(T, string, string) ObjectExtension.IsNotNull(object) ObjectExtension.IsNull(object) Constructors NonCryptographicHashAlgorithm(int) Called from constructors in derived classes to initialize the Verifier.NonCryptographicHashAlgorithm class. protected NonCryptographicHashAlgorithm(int hashLengthInBytes) Parameters hashLengthInBytes int The number of bytes produced from this hash algorithm. Exceptions ArgumentOutOfRangeException hashLengthInBytes is less than 1. Properties HashLengthInBytes Gets the number of bytes produced from this hash algorithm. public int HashLengthInBytes { get; } Property Value int The number of bytes produced from this hash algorithm. Methods Append(byte[]) Appends the contents of source to the data already processed for the current hash computation. public void Append(byte[] source) Parameters source byte[] The data to process. Exceptions ArgumentNullException source is null. Append(Stream) Appends the contents of stream to the data already processed for the current hash computation. public void Append(Stream stream) Parameters stream Stream The data to process. Exceptions ArgumentNullException stream is null. See Also Stream Append(ReadOnlySpan<byte>) When overridden in a derived class, appends the contents of source to the data already processed for the current hash computation. public abstract void Append(ReadOnlySpan<byte> source) Parameters source ReadOnlySpan<byte> The data to process. GetCurrentHash() Gets the current computed hash value without modifying accumulated state. public byte[] GetCurrentHash() Returns byte[] The hash value for the data already provided. GetCurrentHash(Span<byte>) Writes the computed hash value to destination without modifying accumulated state. public int GetCurrentHash(Span<byte> destination) Parameters destination Span<byte> The buffer that receives the computed hash value. Returns int The number of bytes written to destination, which is always HashLengthInBytes. Exceptions ArgumentException destination is shorter than HashLengthInBytes. GetCurrentHashCore(Span<byte>) When overridden in a derived class, writes the computed hash value to destination without modifying accumulated state. protected abstract void GetCurrentHashCore(Span<byte> destination) Parameters destination Span<byte> The buffer that receives the computed hash value. Remarks Implementations of this method must write exactly HashLengthInBytes bytes to destination. Do not assume that the buffer was zero-initialized. The Verifier.NonCryptographicHashAlgorithm class validates the size of the buffer before calling this method, and slices the span down to be exactly HashLengthInBytes in length. GetHashAndReset() Gets the current computed hash value and clears the accumulated state. public byte[] GetHashAndReset() Returns byte[] The hash value for the data already provided. GetHashAndReset(Span<byte>) Writes the computed hash value to destination then clears the accumulated state. public int GetHashAndReset(Span<byte> destination) Parameters destination Span<byte> The buffer that receives the computed hash value. Returns int The number of bytes written to destination, which is always HashLengthInBytes. Exceptions ArgumentException destination is shorter than HashLengthInBytes. GetHashAndResetCore(Span<byte>) Writes the computed hash value to destination then clears the accumulated state. protected virtual void GetHashAndResetCore(Span<byte> destination) Parameters destination Span<byte> The buffer that receives the computed hash value. Remarks Implementations of this method must write exactly HashLengthInBytes bytes to destination. Do not assume that the buffer was zero-initialized. The Verifier.NonCryptographicHashAlgorithm class validates the size of the buffer before calling this method, and slices the span down to be exactly HashLengthInBytes in length. The default implementation of this method calls GetCurrentHashCore(Span<byte>) followed by Reset(). Overrides of this method do not need to call either of those methods, but must ensure that the caller cannot observe a difference in behavior. Reset() When overridden in a derived class, resets the hash computation to the initial state. public abstract void Reset() TryGetCurrentHash(Span<byte>, out int) Attempts to write the computed hash value to destination without modifying accumulated state. public bool TryGetCurrentHash(Span<byte> destination, out int bytesWritten) Parameters destination Span<byte> The buffer that receives the computed hash value. bytesWritten int On success, receives the number of bytes written to destination. Returns bool true if destination is long enough to receive the computed hash value; otherwise, false. TryGetHashAndReset(Span<byte>, out int) Attempts to write the computed hash value to destination. If successful, clears the accumulated state. public bool TryGetHashAndReset(Span<byte> destination, out int bytesWritten) Parameters destination Span<byte> The buffer that receives the computed hash value. bytesWritten int On success, receives the number of bytes written to destination. Returns bool true and clears the accumulated state if destination is long enough to receive the computed hash value; otherwise, false.
